compliant.section: We at OpenAI OpCo, LLC (together with our affiliates, “OpenAI”, “we”, “our” or “us”) respect your privacy and are strongly committed to keeping secure any information we obtain from you or about you.
compliant.legal provisions: Principles relating to processing of personal data - Data Minimisation

compliant.section: This Privacy Policy describes our practices with respect to Personal Information we collect from or about you when you use our website, applications, and services (collectively, “Services”).
compliant.legal provisions: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject

compliant.section: Account Information: When you create an account with us, we will collect information associated with your account, including your name, contact information, account credentials, payment card information, and transaction history, (collectively, “Account Information”).
compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing

compliant.section: Log data includes your Internet Protocol address, browser type and settings, the date and time of your request, and how you interact with our Services.
compliant.legal provisions: Data minimization: The policy indicates they collect data about user interactions, which is generally acceptable for service provision. However, they should specify the purpose and limit collection to what's necessary. Legal basis: They need to specify the legal basis for processing this data, likely consent or legitimate interest depending on the specific interactions tracked.

compliant.section: Usage Data: We may automatically collect information about your use of the Services, such as the types of content that you view or engage with, the features you use and the actions you take, as well as your time zone, country, the dates and times of access, user agent and version, type of computer or mobile device, and your computer connection.
compliant.legal provisions: Data minimization: Similar to log data, they need to justify the purpose and necessity of collecting all these data points. Legal basis: The legal basis for processing usage data should be clarified, likely consent or legitimate interest depending on the specific data and its use.

compliant.section: Device Information: Includes name of the device, operating system, device identifiers, and browser you are using.
compliant.legal provisions: Data minimization: Collection of device information should be minimized and justified. For instance, collecting the device name might not always be necessary. Legal basis: The legal basis for processing device information needs to be specified, and consent might be required depending on the specific data collected and its sensitivity.

compliant.section: Cookies: We use cookies to operate and administer our Services, and improve your experience.
compliant.legal provisions: Purpose limitation and transparency: The policy outlines legitimate purposes for using cookies. Consent: While the policy mentions cookie notifications, it needs to explicitly state that users have the right to refuse cookies and clarify that essential cookies for website functionality don't require consent.

compliant.section: You can set your browser to accept all cookies, to reject all cookies, or to notify you whenever a cookie is offered so that you can decide each time whether to accept it.
compliant.legal provisions: Conditions for consent: The policy correctly mentions user control over cookie settings, aligning with the requirement for freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous consent.

compliant.section: Analytics: We may use a variety of online analytics products that use cookies to help us analyze how users use our Services and enhance your experience when you use the Services.
compliant.legal provisions: Legitimate interest: Using analytics for service improvement is a legitimate interest. However, they need to ensure data minimization and anonymization where possible. Transparency: The policy should clearly inform users about the specific analytics tools used and the data collected.

compliant.section: To provide, administer, maintain and/or analyze the Services; To improve our Services and conduct research; To communicate with you; including to send you information about our Services and events; To develop new programs and services;
compliant.legal provisions: Purpose limitation: The policy outlines legitimate purposes for processing personal data. Legal basis: For each purpose, they need to specify the legal basis, such as consent for marketing communications or legitimate interest for service improvement.

compliant.section: To prevent fraud, criminal activity, or misuses of our Services, and to protect the security of our IT systems, architecture, and networks;
compliant.legal provisions: Legitimate interest: Processing data for fraud prevention and security is a legitimate interest. However, they should implement appropriate safeguards and ensure data minimization.

compliant.section: To carry out business transfers; and To comply with legal obligations and legal process and to protect our rights, privacy, safety, or property, and/or that of our affiliates, you, or other third parties.
compliant.legal provisions: Legal obligation and legitimate interest: These sections cover legitimate processing grounds. However, they should specify the legal obligations and provide more details about legitimate interest in protecting rights and safety.

compliant.section: Aggregated or de-identified information. We may aggregate or de-identify Personal Information so that it may no longer be used to identify you and use such information to analyze the effectiveness of our Services, to improve and add features to our Services, to conduct research and for other similar purposes.
compliant.legal provisions: Data minimization and purpose limitation: Using aggregated or de-identified data is generally compliant if it cannot be re-identified. However, they should still adhere to purpose limitation and data minimization principles.

compliant.section: In addition, from time to time, we may analyze the general behavior and characteristics of users of our Services and share aggregated information like general user statistics with third parties, publish such aggregated information or make such aggregated information generally available.
compliant.legal provisions: Data minimization and transparency: Sharing aggregated data is generally acceptable if it's truly anonymized. However, they should be transparent about the level of aggregation and ensure individuals cannot be re-identified.

compliant.section: We may collect aggregated information through the Services, through cookies, and through other means described in this Privacy Policy.
compliant.legal provisions: Transparency and lawfulness: While this statement aims for transparency, it needs to be more specific about the "other means" and ensure they align with GDPR's lawful data processing principles.

compliant.section: We will maintain and use de-identified information in anonymous or de-identified form and we will not attempt to reidentify the information, unless required by law.
compliant.legal provisions: Data security and confidentiality: This statement aligns with GDPR's requirement to implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data.

compliant.section: Vendors and Service Providers: To assist us in meeting business operations needs and to perform certain services and functions, we may provide Personal Information to vendors and service providers, including providers of hosting services, customer service vendors, cloud services, email communication software, web analytics services, and other information technology providers, among others. \nPursuant to our instructions, these parties will access, process, or store Personal Information only in the course of performing their duties to us.
compliant.legal provisions: Data processing agreements, requirements for processors

compliant.section: Legal Requirements: We may share your Personal Information, including information about your interaction with our Services, with government authorities, industry peers, or other third parties (i) if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to comply with a legal obligation, (ii) to protect and defend our rights or property, (iii) if we determine, in our sole discretion, that there is a violation of our terms, policies, or the law; (iv) to detect or prevent fraud or other illegal activity; (v) to protect the safety, security, and integrity of our products, employees, or users, or the public, or (vi) to protect against legal liability.
compliant.legal provisions: Legal obligation, legitimate interests (compliance with law, security, fraud prevention)

compliant.section: Your rights Depending on location, individuals may have certain statutory rights in relation to their Personal Information. For example, you may have the right to: Access your Personal Information and information relating to how it is processed.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to information, access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability, object.

compliant.section: Delete your Personal Information from our records.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten").

compliant.section: Rectify or update your Personal Information.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to rectification.

compliant.section: Transfer your Personal Information to a third party (right to data portability).
compliant.legal provisions: Right to data portability.

compliant.section: Restrict how we process your Personal Information.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to restriction of processing.

compliant.section: Withdraw your consent—where we rely on consent as the legal basis for processing at any time.
compliant.legal provisions: Conditions for consent, right to withdraw consent.

compliant.section: Object to how we process your Personal Information.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to object.

compliant.section: Lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

compliant.section: To the extent provided for by local law and subject to applicable exceptions, individuals may have the following privacy rights in relation to their Personal Information: The right to know information about our processing of your Personal Information, including the specific pieces of Personal Information that we have collected from you
compliant.legal provisions: Right to be informed, Right of access

compliant.section: The right to request deletion of your Personal Information
compliant.legal provisions: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')

compliant.section: The right to correct your Personal Information
compliant.legal provisions: Right to rectification

compliant.section: The right to be free from discrimination relating to the exercise of any of your privacy rights
compliant.legal provisions: Right to object, including profiling

compliant.section: We don’t “sell” Personal Information or “share” Personal Information for cross-contextual behavioral advertising (as those terms are defined under applicable local law)
compliant.legal provisions: Right to object, including profiling

compliant.section: We also don’t process sensitive Personal Information for the purposes of inferring characteristics about a consumer
compliant.legal provisions: Processing of special categories of personal data

compliant.section: Exercising your rights. To the extent applicable under local law, you can exercise privacy rights described in this section by submitting a request through privacy.
compliant.legal provisions: Transparent information, communication and modalities for the exercise of the rights of the data subject

compliant.section: 6. Children Our Service is not directed to children under the age of 13. OpenAI does not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under the age of 13.
compliant.legal provisions: Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to information society services.

compliant.section: 8. Security and retention We implement commercially reasonable technical, administrative, and organizational measures to protect Personal Information both online and offline from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.
compliant.legal provisions: Security of processing

compliant.section: We’ll retain your Personal Information for only as long as we need in order to provide our Service to you, or for other legitimate business purposes such as resolving disputes, safety and security reasons, or complying with our legal obligations.
compliant.legal provisions: Principles relating to processing of personal data (specifically, storage limitation)

non_compliant.section: These updates do not apply to individuals located in the European Economic Area, UK, and Switzerland.
non_compliant.amend: The policy should apply to individuals in the EEA, UK and Switzerland as GDPR applies to organisations that process personal data of individuals in the EU/EEA, regardless of whether the organisation is based in the EU/EEA or not.

non_compliant.section: For more details on cookies, please visit All About Cookies (opens in a new window).
non_compliant.legal provisions: Transparency and accessibility: While providing additional information is good, the policy should clearly and concisely explain cookie usage within the policy itself. Linking to external websites shouldn't replace clear and accessible information within the privacy policy.
non_compliant.amend: Provide a comprehensive explanation of cookie usage, types of cookies used, purpose, and duration, directly within the privacy policy. While linking to external resources can be helpful, it shouldn't replace clear and concise information within the policy itself.

non_compliant.section: As noted above, we may use Content you provide us to improve our Services, for example to train the models that power ChatGPT. Read our instructions (opens in a new window) on how you can opt out of our use of your Content to train our models.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Lawful basis for processing, right to object
non_compliant.amend: Specify a clear and lawful basis for processing user content for model training, such as consent or legitimate interest. Provide users with a clear and easy way to opt out of such processing, ensuring the opt-out mechanism is prominent and accessible.

non_compliant.section: Business Transfers: If we are involved in strategic transactions, reorganization, bankruptcy, receivership, or transition of service to another provider (collectively, a “Transaction”), your Personal Information and other information may be disclosed in the diligence process with counterparties and others assisting with the Transaction and transferred to a successor or affiliate as part of that Transaction along with other assets.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information requirements for data subjects, right to object
non_compliant.amend: Provide specific information about the potential transfer of personal data in a business transfer, including the purposes and legal basis. Offer data subjects the right to object to such transfers or provide clear mechanisms for consent.

non_compliant.section: Business Account Administrators: When you join a ChatGPT Enterprise or business account, the administrators of that account may access and control your OpenAI account. \nIn addition, if you create an account using an email address belonging to your employer or another organization, we may share the fact that you have an OpenAI account and certain account information, such as your email address, with your employer or organization to, for example, enable you to be added to their business account.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Lawful basis for processing, special categories of data
non_compliant.amend: Clearly define the legal basis for processing employee data in the context of business accounts. If sensitive personal data is involved, ensure explicit consent or another valid legal basis under Article 9.

non_compliant.section: Other Users and Third Parties You Share Information With: Certain features allow you to display or share information with other users or third parties. For example, you may share ChatGPT conversations with other users via shared links or send information to third-party applications via custom actions for GPTs.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information requirements for data subjects, right to object
non_compliant.amend: Provide clear and concise information to users about the implications of sharing information through these features, including potential risks to their privacy. Offer users control over the sharing of their information, allowing them to choose what and how they share.

non_compliant.section: Be sure you trust any user or third party with whom you share information.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Principles relating to processing of personal data (specifically, integrity and confidentiality).
non_compliant.amend: Rephrase to clarify that the company is responsible for ensuring the security of personal data, even when shared with third parties.

non_compliant.section: Given the technical complexity of how our models work, we may not be able to correct the inaccuracy in every instance. In that case, you may request that we remove your Personal Information from ChatGPT’s output by filling out this form (opens in a new window).
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten").
non_compliant.amend: While offering removal as a solution is acceptable, the policy should clearly state that individuals have a right to erasure and it should not be presented as contingent on the company's technical capabilities.

non_compliant.section: We may disclose this information to our affiliates, vendors and service providers to process in accordance with our instructions; to law enforcement and other third parties for the legal reasons described above; to parties involved in Transactions; and to corporate administrators of enterprise or team accounts.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Responsibility of the controller, Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law, Processor
non_compliant.amend: The policy should specify the legal basis for disclosing data to each category of recipient (e.g., affiliates, vendors, law enforcement). It should also specify appropriate safeguards for international transfers if applicable.

non_compliant.section: We may disclose this information to our affiliates, vendors and service providers to process in accordance with our instructions; to law enforcement and other third parties for the legal reasons described above; to parties involved in Transactions; and to other users and third parties you choose to share it with.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Responsibility of the controller, Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law, Processor
non_compliant.amend: Similar to the previous point, the policy needs to be more specific about the legal basis for each disclosure and the safeguards in place.

non_compliant.section: We may disclose this information to our affiliates, vendors and service providers to process in accordance with our instructions; to law enforcement and other third parties for the legal reasons described above; and to parties involved in Transactions.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Responsibility of the controller, Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law, Processor
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more details about the legal basis for disclosure and safeguards, especially for international data transfers.

non_compliant.section: Your account login credentials and payment card information (Sensitive Personal Information) We disclose this information to our affiliates, vendors and service providers, law enforcement, and parties involved in Transactions.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Responsibility of the controller, Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law, Processor, Security of processing
non_compliant.amend: Disclosing sensitive data like login credentials requires a strong legal basis and robust security measures. The policy should explicitly state these.

non_compliant.section: If you do not have an account with us, or if we suspect fraudulent or malicious activity, we may ask you to provide additional Personal Information and proof of residency for verification.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Principles relating to processing of personal data (data minimisation)
non_compliant.amend: Requesting proof of residency might be excessive for verification purposes. The policy should ensure data collected is necessary and proportionate to the purpose.

non_compliant.section: If we cannot verify your identity, we will not be able to honor your request.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Transparent information, communication and modalities for the exercise of the rights of the data subject
non_compliant.amend: While verification is important, the policy should also explain alternative ways to exercise rights if identity cannot be verified.

non_compliant.section: To appeal a decision, please send your request to dsar@openai.com.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject/Right of access by the data subject/Right to rectification
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide clear and accessible information about how individuals can exercise their data rights, including the right to access, rectification, erasure, and objection. It should specify the contact point for data subjects to make requests related to their data.

non_compliant.section: Legal basis for processing. Our legal bases for processing your Personal Information include: Performance of a contract with you when we provide and maintain our Services.
non_compliant.amend: While performance of a contract can be a legal basis for processing, the policy should comprehensively list all legal bases relied upon for different processing activities. For instance, it should mention consent (if applicable), legal obligations, or legitimate interests, and explain how these bases apply to specific data processing operations.

non_compliant.section: 9. International users By using our Service, you understand and acknowledge that your Personal Information will be processed and stored in our facilities and servers in the United States and may be disclosed to our service providers and affiliates in other jurisdictions.
non_compliant.legal provisions: General principles for transfers/Transfers of personal data to third countries or international organisations
non_compliant.amend: The policy needs to elaborate on the safeguards taken to ensure adequate protection of personal data when transferring it to the United States, considering it's not recognized as providing an adequate level of data protection by the EU. This might involve mentioning adherence to Privacy Shield principles (if applicable), Standard Contractual Clauses, or other appropriate safeguards.
